channel.title: math.GN updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GN updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: The pseudometric topology induced by upper asymptotic density
item.description: arXiv:2410.06559v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Upper asymptotic density induces a pseudometric on the power set of the natural numbers, with respect to which $P(\mathbb{N})$ is complete. The collection $D$ of sets with asymptotic density is closed in this pseudometric, and closed subsets of $D$ are characterised by a generalisation of an additivity property (AP0).
item.dc:creator: Jonathan M. Keith

item.title: A fixed point result of Kannan-type for multi-valued mapping on fuzzy metric spaces
item.description: arXiv:2405.04179v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We prove a Kannan-type fixed point theorem for multi-valued mappings on G-complete fuzzy metric spaces. The proof uses the Hausdorff fuzzy metric space which was introduced by Rodriguez-Lopez and Romaguera [19].
item.dc:creator: Shunya Hashimoto, Aqib Saghir

item.title: Better estimates of H\"older thickness of fractals
item.description: arXiv:2312.04659v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Dimensions of level sets of generic continuous functions and generic H\"older functions defined on a fractal $F$ encode information about the geometry, ``the thickness" of $F$. While in the continuous case this quantity is related to a reasonably tame dimension notion which is called the topological Hausdorff dimension of $F$, the H\"older case seems to be highly nontrivial. A number of earlier papers attempted to deal with this problem, carrying out investigation in the case of Hausdorff dimension and box dimension. In this paper we continue our study of the Hausdorff dimension of almost every level set of generic $1$-H\"older-$ {\alpha}$ functions, denoted by $D_{*}( {\alpha}, F)$. We substantially improve previous lower and upper bounds on $D_{*}( {\alpha}, \Delta)$, where $\Delta$ is the Sierpi\'nski triangle, achieving asymptotically equal bounds as $\alpha\to 0+$. Using a similar argument, we also give an even stronger lower bound on the generic lower box dimension of level sets. Finally, we construct a connected fractal $F$ on which there is a phase transition of $D_{*}( {\alpha}, F)$, thus providing the first example exhibiting this behavior.
item.dc:creator: Zolt\'an Buczolich, Bal\'azs Maga, G\'asp\'ar V\'ertesy
